articles.author: Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Russia's ability to mete out like-for-like retaliation if Western leaders seize its frozen assets has been eroded by dwindling foreign investment, but officials and economists say there are still ways it can strike back.
articles.title: Russia can't match a Western asset seizure, but it can inflict pain

articles.author: David Swanson
articles.description: Violent clashes erupted early on Wednesday morning on the campus of the University of California in Los Angeles between pro-Palestinian protesters and a group of counter-demonstrators supporting Israel.
articles.title: UCLA campus protests over Gaza war erupt into violent clashes between rival groups

articles.author: Greg Torode
articles.description: A senior U.S. official on Thursday urged China and Russia to match declarations by the United States and others that only humans, and never artificial intelligence, would make decisions on deploying nuclear weapons.
articles.title: US official urges China, Russia to declare only humans, not AI, control nuclear weapons

articles.author: Jack Queen, Jody Godoy, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: New York prosecutors on Thursday will ask the judge overseeing Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial to impose more fines on the former U.S. president for violating a gag order that prohibits him from talking about witnesses and jurors.
articles.title: Trump hush-money trial judge to weigh more fines for defying gag order

articles.author: Nellie Peyton
articles.description: In the South African township where Luke Fleurs grew up, some friends joined gangs before they reached high school age, but Fleurs found another path: he was so brilliant at soccer that he rose to be a professional player at South Africa's top club.
articles.title: Soccer star's murder highlights South Africa's crime problem as election nears

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: South Korea's foreign ministry on Thursday raised the terrorism alert level for five diplomatic offices in the region citing intelligence that North Korea may attempt to harm its officials.
articles.title: South Korea raises diplomatic alert levels citing North Korea threats

articles.author: Manoj Kumar, Aftab Ahmed
articles.description: A lower turnout so far in India’s long general election has rattled Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s campaign managers, raising into question whether his Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its allies can achieve the landslide victory predicted by opinion polls just one month ago.
articles.title: Low turnout, apathy in India election a worry for Modi's campaign

articles.author: Andrew Hay
articles.description: At Columbia University, tensions between the administration and students protesting over Israel's war in Gaza have reached the point that scores of New York City police marched onto campus to clear an encampment and arrest demonstrators who had commandeered a classroom building.
articles.title: Berkeley takes hands-off approach to Gaza campus protests. Columbia called the police

articles.author: Tora Agarwala
articles.description: India on Thursday deported the first group of Myanmar refugees who had sought shelter after a 2021 military coup, a top state minister said, following weeks of efforts that were hampered by fighting between Myanmar's rebel forces and the ruling junta.
articles.title: India deports Myanmar refugees who fled 2021 coup

articles.author: Joan Faus
articles.description: Crunch elections in Catalonia next week will test the wisdom of the latest political gambles by Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez, who aims to use the vote to buoy his power nationally but risks inadvertently awakening a dormant Catalan separatism.
articles.title: Spain PM Sanchez's political gambles face litmus test in Catalan election
